impact.label: Health impact
impact.high: High smoking levels can cause serious health harm. Consider reducing gradually.
impact.medium: Moderate smoking levels still impact health. Try to reduce further.
impact.low: Low smoking levels, but quitting entirely is best for your health.

recent.title: Recent history
recent.empty: No data yet. Start tracking today.

health.title: Health Information
health.description: Understand the harms of smoking and the benefits of quitting

harm.title: Harms of Smoking
harm.description: Smoking affects nearly every organ in the body

lungs.title: Effects on the lungs
lungs.1: Lung cancer ‚Äì Smoking causes up to 90% of deaths from lung cancer
lungs.2: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), including chronic bronchitis and emphysema
lungs.3: Increased risk of respiratory infections and worsened asthma symptoms

heart.title: Effects on the heart
heart.1: Coronary artery disease leading to chest pain and heart attack
heart.2: Increased blood pressure and heart rate
heart.3: Higher risk of stroke from blood clots or brain bleeding

brain.title: Effects on the brain
brain.1: Nicotine causes addiction and alters brain activity
brain.2: Increased risk of stroke with potential permanent brain damage
brain.3: Studies show a link between smoking and increased risk of Alzheimer‚Äôs disease

benefit.title: Benefits of Quitting Smoking
benefit.description: The body begins to recover immediately after quitting

timeline.title: Recovery Timeline
timeline.description: Positive changes will occur over time

economic.title: Economic Benefits of Quitting
economic.note: *Estimated based on smoking 1 pack per day at 30,000ƒë per pack

tracker.title: Start Tracking Your Smoking Habit
tracker.description: The first step to quitting is understanding your current habit

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.1.title: Who is responsible for your information?
privacy.1.content.1: We are the entity responsible for managing and protecting the personal data you provide while using the smoking cessation support system.
privacy.2.title: What information do we collect?
privacy.2.content.3: - Smoking status, logs, and quit plans
privacy.2.content.4: - Feedback and messages within the system
privacy.2.content.6: - Usage behavior (login frequency, language, accessed features)
privacy.3.title: Purpose of information use
privacy.3.content.2: - Analyze, improve, and personalize the experience
privacy.4.title: Sharing of personal information
privacy.4.content.1: We do not share your personal information with third parties unless:
privacy.4.content.4: - Data is anonymized for academic research purposes
privacy.5.title: Data retention period
privacy.5.content.1: Your information will be stored until:
privacy.5.content.3:
- You request deletion of personal data
Some data may be retained as required by law.
privacy.6.title: Your rights
privacy.6.content.3: - Request updates, corrections, or deletion of your information
privacy.7.title: Data security
privacy.7.content.1: - Data is stored on a secure internal system.
privacy.7.content.2: - We use reasonable security measures to prevent unauthorized access, loss, or data breaches.
privacy.8.title: Cookies and behavior analytics
privacy.8.content.1: The system may use cookies to:
privacy.8.content.3:
- Analyze user behavior to improve the experience
You can disable cookies via browser settings, but some features may not function properly.
privacy.9.title: For users under 18
privacy.9.content.1: The system is not intended for users under 18. If unauthorized use is detected, we may suspend the account and delete related data.
privacy.10.title: Policy changes
privacy.10.content.1: This policy may be adjusted to reflect legal or technical changes. Major changes will be announced directly within the system.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: User Agreement
terms.alert: Important Notice: Please read these terms carefully before using the system. By accessing and using the service, you agree to the entire content of this Terms of Service.

notice.content: Please read these terms carefully before using the system. By accessing and using the service, you agree to the entire content of this Terms of Service.

terms.1.title: Scope of Application
terms.1.description: These terms apply to the use of the smoking cessation support system, including the following features:
terms.1.note: The system is intended for personal and educational purposes only, not for commercial or professional medical use.
terms.2.title: Not a Medical Service
terms.2.description: The system does not provide medical diagnosis or treatment. All content is for reference only. If you need medical support, consult a doctor or professional healthcare provider.
terms.3.title: Not for Emergency Use
terms.3.description: If you are experiencing a serious or emergency health issue, do not use this system. Instead, contact the nearest medical center or call 115 immediately.
terms.4.title: User Accounts
4.items: Users must be at least 18 years old to create an account.
You are responsible for securing your account and password.
Do not share your account with others.
If unauthorized access is detected, notify the development team immediately.
terms.5.title: Privacy Policy
terms.5.description: We are committed to protecting your personal information. Data you provide (name, email, phone number, smoking habits...) is used solely to support your quit-smoking journey. We do not share data with third parties.
terms.6.title: Intellectual Property Rights
terms.6.description: All content, design, and source code of the system belong to the development team. You may not copy, reuse, or modify the system without permission.
terms.7.title: System Content Changes
terms.7.description: The system may update or change features at any time to improve the learning experience and user support. Changes will be publicly announced if necessary.
terms.8.title: Limitation of Liability
terms.8.description: The system is provided "as-is." The development team is not liable for any risks arising from misuse or misunderstanding of content.
terms.9.title: Account Suspension or Termination
terms.9.description: We reserve the right to suspend or delete user accounts if any of the following are detected:
9.items: Using the system for improper purposes
terms.10.title: Governing Law
terms.10.description: These terms are governed by the laws of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. For questions or concerns, please contact the development team via email or internal support channels.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers during your quitting journey
faq.1.title: About the quitting process
faq.1.1.a:
This is a four-step quit-smoking planning method:

Set a quit date

Tell others

Anticipate challenges

Remove tobacco
faq.1.2.q: How addicted am I to nicotine?
faq.1.2.a: You can self-assess by looking at how often you smoke, how soon after waking you smoke, and how uncomfortable you feel without smoking.
faq.1.3.q: Can I smoke just one last cigarette?
faq.1.3.a: No! 'Just one' often becomes an excuse that leads to relapse and going back to the old habit.
faq.1.4.a: It means quitting completely and immediately without any aids. It works for some people but can be very stressful.
faq.1.5.q: What are the health benefits of quitting?
faq.1.5.a: After just 20 minutes, your blood pressure drops. After 2‚Äì3 weeks, blood circulation improves. After a few months, the risks of heart and lung diseases significantly decrease.
faq.1.6.q: How can I get through the first smoke-free day?
faq.1.6.a: Avoid triggers, keep your hands and mouth busy (chew gum, drink water), and remind yourself why you're quitting.
faq.1.7.q: I'm very irritable and anxious when quitting ‚Äì what should I do?
faq.1.7.a: Practice deep breathing, light meditation, exercise, or talk to a friend, loved one, coach, or support group.
faq.1.8.q: What should I do during smoke breaks at work?
faq.1.8.a: You can take a walk, listen to music, drink water, eat fruit, or use nicotine gum as a substitute.
faq.1.9.a: Yes. They help reduce withdrawal symptoms by delivering nicotine slowly and steadily.
faq.1.10.a: Yes, they can be used throughout the day. But use the correct dose and timing to avoid dependency.
faq.1.11.q: Should I use e-cigarettes to quit?
faq.1.11.a: Not recommended. E-cigarettes still contain nicotine and may lead to relapse.
faq.1.12.a: Some people find it helpful, but there's no solid scientific proof of its long-term effectiveness.
faq.1.13.a: It depends on the individual. Its effectiveness isn‚Äôt widely proven and shouldn‚Äôt replace medical methods.
faq.1.14.q: Is laser therapy proven to work?
faq.1.14.a: Similar to acupuncture, clinical evidence is still lacking.
faq.1.15.q: Are there good books to read while quitting?
faq.1.15.a: Yes. Some books like "Allen Carr‚Äôs Easy Way to Stop Smoking" are highly rated.
faq.1.16.q: Where can I find more information?
faq.1.16.a: You can look in the app, online support groups, or consult official medical resources.
faq.2.title: About the application
faq.2.1.a:
This is a quit-smoking support website that helps you:

Track your progress,

Log your smoking history,

Set goals and view stats,

Interact with coaches or the community.
faq.2.2.q: How do I access the system?
faq.2.2.a: You can access it via a web browser at our website address.
faq.2.3.q: Can I back up my data?
faq.2.3.a: Yes. When you log in with your personal account (email or Google), your data is securely and automatically stored on our system.
faq.2.4.a: Yes. You can change the language in the 'Settings' section.
faq.2.5.q: What languages does the system support?
faq.2.5.a: Currently supports Vietnamese, English, and may expand to other languages in the future.
faq.3.title: About PRO features
faq.3.1.q: What are the features of PRO?
faq.3.1.a:
Personalized quit plan
Tailored roadmap based on your habits and goals.

Addiction analysis
Track progress, assess effectiveness, and receive deep insights.

Online consultation
Get support from experts who accompany you during your journey.

AI companion
A 24/7 intelligent assistant to keep you motivated and informed.

Advanced reports & statistics
Detailed data visualization about your quit-smoking progress.
faq.3.2.q: Is PRO a one-time purchase or subscription?
faq.4.title: Quitters community
faq.4.1.a: Be respectful, no spam, no conflict, and no misinformation.
faq.4.2.q: I can't chat ‚Äì what should I do?
faq.4.2.a: Check your internet connection or verify your email before joining the chat.
faq.5.title: Account and registration
faq.5.1.q: I didn‚Äôt receive the activation email
faq.5.1.a: Check your spam folder. If not found, request to resend the confirmation email.
